info.title: Wikimedia REST API
info.description:
This API aims to provide coherent and low-latency access to Wikimedia content and services. It is currently in beta testing, so things aren't completely locked down yet. Each entry point has explicit stability markers to inform you about development status and change policy, according to [our API version policy](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning).
### High-volume access
  - Don't perform more than 200 requests/s to this API.
  - Set a unique `User-Agent` header that allows us to contact you
    quickly. Email addresses or URLs of contact pages work well.

get.summary: List page-related API entry points.
get.description: Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable)

200.description: A list of page-related API end points.

get.summary: List all pages.
get.description: Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental). Don't rely on this.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page token, provided by _links.next.href property.

200.description: A pageable list of page titles.

get.summary: Get latest revision metadata for a title.
get.description: Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

200.description: The latest revision metadata for the provided title.

404.description: Unknown page title or no revisions found.

x-amples.title: Get rev by title from storage

get.summary: List revisions for a title.
get.description:
Currently this lists all revisions that ever used this title and are
stored in RESTBase, but eventually it should return the
linear history (across renames) of the page currently using this
title.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page token, provided by _links.next.href property.

200.description: A list of revisions for a title.

get.summary: Get latest HTML for a title.
get.description: Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of section IDs.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description:
The latest HTML for the given page title.

See [the MediaWiki DOM
spec](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec) for a
description of the MediaWiki-specific semantic markup in this HTML.
Note that additional metadata is available in the HTML head.

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the revision and render timeuuid
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"
This ETag can be passed to the HTML save end point (as
`base_etag` POST parameter), and can also be used to retrieve
the exact corresponding data-parsoid metadata, by requesting
the specific `revision` and `tid` indicated by the `ETag`.

x-amples.title: Get html by title from storage

post.summary: Save a new revision using HTML.
post.description:
Save a new revision of a page given in [Parsoid
HTML](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec)
format.

For new pages, or when editting the latest revision of a page,
the `base_etag` parameter should be left empty. For editing old revisions,
it should contain the `ETag` header of the revision the edit is derived from.

The latest page revision ETag header could be provided in the If-Match header
to detect edit conflicts. If the new page is created, appropriate user cookies
must be provided.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: base_etag
parameters.description: ETag header of the revision the edit is based on. Should be supplied for all existing pages to ensure clean round-tripping.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: HTML of the page to save.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: CSRF edit token provided by the MW API.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment summarizing the change.

parameters.name: is_minor
parameters.description: Flag indicating a minor change.

parameters.name: is_bot
parameters.description: Flag indicating a bot edit.

200.description: The content was not changed, and no new version was created.

201.description: A new revision of the page has been created

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the new revision and timeuuid,
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"

400.description: Invalid request - lack of required parameters, bad ETags etc.

get.summary: List HTML revisions for a title.
get.description:
This currently only lists revisions that are already stored in RESTBase.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The next page token, provided by _links.next.href property.

200.description: A list of revisions for the given title.

get.summary: Get HTML for a specific title/revision & optionally timeuuid.
get.description: Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The revision's time ID

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of section IDs

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description:
The html for the given page, revision and tid.

See [the MediaWiki DOM
spec](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec) for a
description of the MediaWiki-specific semantic markup in this HTML.
Note that additional metadata is available in the HTML head.

This HTML can be edited using arbitrary HTML tools. The modified HTML
can be converted back to wikitext using the
[/transform/html/to/wikitext{/title}{/revision}](#!/Transforms/transform_html_to_wikitext__title___revision__post)
entry point.

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the revision and render timeuuid
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"
This ETag can be passed to the HTML save end point (as
`base_etag` POST parameter), and can also be used to retrieve
the exact corresponding data-parsoid metadata, by requesting
the specific `revision` and `tid` indicated by the `ETag`.

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: Get data-parsoid metadata for a specific title/revision/tid.
get.description:
Data-parsoid is metadata used by
[Parsoid](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid) to support clean
round-tripping conversions between HTML and Wikitext. Among other
things, it contains the original Wikitext offsets of each HTML
element, keyed by element ID. The format is unstable.

The metadata in data-parsoid is specific to a specific HTML render.
For this reason, you need to supply the exact `revision` and `tid` as
provided in the `ETag` header of the HTML response.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The revision's time ID

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: The latest Parsoid data for the given page

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: List all page revisions.
get.description:
Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental).
Don't rely on this.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page token, provided by _links.next.href property.

200.description: The queriable sub-items

get.summary: Get metadata about a specific revision.
get.description: Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision id

200.description: The revision's properties

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

post.summary: Save a new revision of a page using Wikitext.
post.description:
For new pages, or when editting the latest revision of a page,
the `base_etag` parameter should be left empty.
For editing old revisions, it should contain the ETag header
of the revision the edit is derived from.

The latest page revision ETag header should be provided in the If-Match header
to detect edit conflicts. If the new page is created, appropriate user cookies
must be provided.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: base_etag
parameters.description: The ETag header of the revision the edit is based on.

parameters.name: wikitext
parameters.description: The wikitext source of the page to save

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MW API

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The summary of the change

parameters.name: is_minor
parameters.description: Whether this represents a minor change

parameters.name: is_bot
parameters.description: Whether the change is being made by a bot

200.description: The existing revision of the page matches the sent text

201.description: A new revision of the page has been created

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the new revision and timeuuid,
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"

400.description: Invalid request - lack of required parameters, bad ETags etc.

get.summary: Get mobile-optimized HTML sections for a title.
get.description:
Retrieve the latest HTML for a page title optimised for viewing with
native mobile applications. Note that the output is split by sections.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: JSON containing HTML sections and metadata for the given page title.

get.summary: Get mobile-optimized HTML lead section and metadata for a title.
get.description:
Retrieve the lead section of the latest HTML for a page title optimised
for viewing with native mobile applications.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: The HTML for the given page title.

get.summary: Get non-lead mobile-optimized HTML sections for a title.
get.description:
Retrieve the remainder of the latest HTML (without the lead section) for
a page title optimised for viewing with native mobile applications,
provided as a JSON object containing the sections.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: JSON wrapping HTML sections for the given page title.

get.summary: Get mobile-optimized text and metadata for a title.
get.description:
Retrieve the *lite* (text-only) version of the latest HTML for a page
title optimised for viewing with native mobile applications.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental). Don't rely on this.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

200.description: JSON comprising the HTML and various page attributes for the given page title.

get.summary: Get PNG graph images referenced in page revisions.
get.description:
Retrieve PNG graph images embedded in specific revisions of a
page. See [the Graphoid
documentation](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Graph#Graphoid_service)
for details.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The page title

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The page revision, or 0 for the latest

parameters.name: graph_id
parameters.description: The graph ID, consisting of a hash and the suffix `.png`.

200.description: The PNG render of the requested graph.

403.description: access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: Get a text extract & thumb summary of a page.
get.description:
The summary response includes a text extract of the first several
sentences, as well as information about a thumbnail that represents
the page.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: The summary for the given page

get.summary: Get pages related to the given title
get.description:
Returns summaries for 5 pages related to the given page. Summaries include
page title, namespace and id along with short text description of the page
and a thumbnail.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

200.description: The related pages

get.summary: Get content for a random page
get.description:
Redirects the client to the URI for the desired format for a random page title.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The desired return format

303.description: The redirect to the desired format URI for a random page

get.summary: Aggregated featured content
get.description:
Provides the aggregated feed content for the given date. The endpoint returns
the featured article of the day, most read articles for the previous day, news
content, a random article, and the featured image and video of the day.

Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)

parameters.name: yyyy
parameters.description: Year the aggregated content is requested for

parameters.name: mm
parameters.description: Month the aggregated content is requested for

parameters.name: dd
parameters.description: Day of the month the aggregated content is requested for

200.description: JSON containing all of the featured content

x-amples.title: Retrieve aggregated feed content for April 29, 2016

post.description:
Transform [Parsoid HTML](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec)
to Wikitext.

- Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)
- Rate limit: 5 req/s

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The page revision

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: The HTML to transform

parameters.name: scrub_wikitext
parameters.description: Normalise the DOM to yield cleaner wikitext?

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
The `ETag` header of the original render indicating it's revision and timeuuid.
Required if both `title` and `revision` parameters are present.

200.description: MediaWiki Wikitext.

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

post.description:
Transform wikitext to HTML. Note that if you set `stash: true`, you
also need to supply the title.

- Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)
- Rate limit: 5 req/s

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The page revision

parameters.name: wikitext
parameters.description: The Wikitext to transform to HTML

parameters.name: body_only
parameters.description: Return only `body.innerHTML`

parameters.name: stash
parameters.description: Whether to temporarily stash the result of the transformation

200.description: See wikipage https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec

403.description: access to the specific revision is restricted

post.summary: Transform modified HTML sections to Wikitext.
post.description:
This entry point provides efficient HTML section edit functionality.
The client can send back only modified HTML sections, and retrieve the
full Wikitext of the page.

- Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)
- Rate limit: 5 req/s

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The page revision

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description: Sections to transform

200.description: Wikitext of the full page.

400.description: Illegal JSON provided or section id does not exist

403.description: access to the specific revision is restricted

post.summary: Check and normalize a TeX formula.
post.description:
Checks the supplied TeX formula for correctness and returns the
normalised formula representation as well as information about
identifiers. Available types are tex and inline-tex. The response
contains the `x-resource-location` header which can be used to retrieve
the render of the checked formula in one of the supported rendering
formats. Just append the value of the header to `/media/math/{format}/`
and perform a GET request against that URL.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#unstable).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The input type of the given formula; can be tex or inline-tex

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The formula to check

200.description: Information about the checked formula

get.summary: Get a previously-stored formula
get.description:
Returns the previously-stored formula via `/media/math/check/{type}` for
the given hash.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#unstable).

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash string of the previous POST data

200.description: Information about the checked formula

404.description: Data for the given hash cannot be found

get.summary: Get rendered formula in the given format.
get.description:
Given a request hash, renders a TeX formula into its mathematic
representation in the given format. When a request is issued to the
`/media/math/check/{format}` POST endpoint, the response contains the
`x-resource-location` header denoting the hash ID of the POST data. Once
obtained, this endpoint has to be used to obtain the actual render.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#unstable).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format; can be svg or mml

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash string of the previous POST data

200.description: The rendered formula

revisions.description: The result format for revision listing

href.description: Relative link to next result page.

data-parsoid.description: Result format for Parsoid data queries

extract.description: First several sentences of an article in plain text

timestamp.description: The time when the page was last editted in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format

items.description: First several sentences of an article in plain text
